c74object.name: dada.graph
c74object.description: Provides an interface for graphs, including autopositioning of nodes

outlet.digest: Node value on mouse hover or click
bang when object is changed via the interface

method.name: (drag)
method.digest: Load file or set background image
method.description: Dragging an llll or text file on the object will load its content, if a proper readable format is recognized. If the file is an image, it will be loaded as object background (whenever meaningful)

method.name: (keyboard)
method.description:
• Esc: reset center to (0, 0) and zoom to 100%
• Tab: autozoom
• Return: place vertices automatically
• Cmd+Z (mac) or Ctrl+Z (win): perform undo step
• Cmd+Shift+Z (mac) or Ctrl+Y (win): perform redo step
Tools are combination of a specific key pressed and some mouse action. Whenever you press the key, if the tool is available, the mouse cursor will switch to the tool specific one.
Available tools are:
• Keep the Z key pressed, then click and drag on the canvas to change the zoom
• Keep the X key pressed, then click and drag on the canvas to move the displayed center
• Keep the L key pressed, click on an element, keep the mouse down and release the mouse on another element to connect the two elements.

method.name: (mouse)
method.description:
• mousewheel scroll: move the visible region
• Cmd+mousewheel scroll (mac) or Ctrl+mousewheel scroll (win): change zoom
• right-click or two-fingers tap: open contextual menu for basic operations
• click+drag on an element ot move it
↪ Add the Alt key to duplicate it
• Cmd+click (mac) or Ctrl+click (win) on to delete it
• right click or two fingers tap: open contextual menu

method.name: autocoord
method.description: Assigns the node coordinates automatically, according to the current autocoordalgo.

method.name: autozoom
method.description: Adapts view and zoom automatically according to the current stars' and planets' positions.

method.name: clear
method.description: Deletes all nodes and vertices.

method.name: domain
method.description: The domain message, followed by two numbers, sets minimum and maximum coordinates to be displayed on the X axis. The domain message, followed by the "start" or "end" symbol and a number, sets the coordinate to be displayed respectively at the left boundary or at the right boundary of the object box.

method.name: dump
method.description: Outputs the current state of the graph, in the syntax. graph (VERTEX1 VERTEX2...) (EDGE1 EDGE2...). Each vertex is an llll shaped as ((coord x y) (label label) (bgcolor r g b a) (bordercolor r g b a) (textcolor r g b a)). Each edge is an llll shaped as (edge_start_vertex_index edge_end_vertex_index (weight edgeweight)).

method.name: getdomain
method.description: The getdomain message outputs from the third outlet the minimum and maximum coordinates displayed on the X axis, preceded by a domain symbol.

method.name: getrange
method.description: The getrange message outputs from the third outlet the minimum and maximum coordinates displayed on the Y axis, preceded by a range symbol.

method.name: getturtle
method.description: The getturtle message outputs the vertex data for the vertex where the turtle is currently located, if any.

method.name: llll
method.description: Any llll will be considered as the bach.roll's gathered syntax to be processed, and the result is output through the outlet(s).

method.name: llll
method.description: Sets the current state of the object. The syntax must follow the one described in the dump message documentation.

method.name: range
method.description: The range message, followed by two numbers, sets minimum and maximum coordinates to be displayed on the Y axis The range message, followed by the "start" or "end" symbol and a number, sets the coordinate to be displayed respectively at the bottom boundary or at top right boundary of the object box.

method.name: read
method.description: The specified file is read from disk and the llll it contains loaded as current state. Syntax is expected to be in the format explained in the dump message documentation.

method.name: setturtle
method.description:
Examples:
• setturtle 3 → Set the turtle on the 3rd vertex
• setturtle coord (0 10) → Set the turtle on the nearest vertex to x=0, y=10
• setturtle label Warsaw → Set the turtle on the vertex having "Warsaw" as label
The setturtle message, followed by an integer N sets the turtle on the N-th vertex, without causing any output. If followed by the "coord" symbol and an llll of the kind (x, y) it sets the turtle on the nearest vertex to the given (x, y) location, always without causing any output.
If relativeturtle is on, the coordinates are expected to be between 0 and 1, relative to the current domain and range (caveat: more precisely, to the domain and range of the latest painted view of the object).
If the setturtle message is followed by the "label" symbol, i.e. setturtle label vertexlabel, the turtle is positioned on the grain (if any) having vertexlabel as label.

method.name: turtle
method.digest: Set the turtle and output vertex data
method.description:
Examples:
• turtle 3 → Set the turtle on the 3rd vertex, and output vertex data
• turtle coord (0 10) → Set the turtle on the nearest vertex to x=0, y=10, and output vertex data
• turtle label Warsaw → Set the turtle on the vertex having "Warsaw" as label, and output vertex data
The setturtle message, followed by an integer N sets the turtle on the N-th vertex, outputting the corresponding vertex data, prepended by the "turtle" symbol and the vertex number. If followed by the "coord" symbol and an llll of the kind (x, y) it sets the turtle on the nearest vertex to the given (x, y) location.
If relativeturtle is on, the coordinates are expected to be between 0 and 1, relative to the current domain and range (caveat: more precisely, to the domain and range of the latest painted view of the object).
If the setturtle message is followed by the "label" symbol, i.e. setturtle label vertexlabel, the turtle is positioned on the grain (if any) having vertexlabel as label.

method.name: turtleclear
method.description:
The turtleclear message will clear the history of turtled vertices (useful in combination with turtlemarkov, to reset the repetition avoidance mechanism).
See also:turtlemarkov

method.name: turtlemarkov
method.digest: Move the turtle on the probability graph
method.description:
The turtlemarkov message will move the turtle on a vertex which is connected to the current vertex, in a probabilistic fashion (i.e.: the more distant vertices are, the less likely it is for the turtle to end up on them). If memory is greater than 1, then repetition with previous states will be avoided, according to such attribute. If there's no connected grain to the current turtled vertex, or if no new vertex could be reached, and "end" notification is sent.
See also:turtleclear

method.name: write
method.description: A write message will save the current state (as llll) in a file, in native format. If an argument is given, this is the filename (if the file is in the search path or in the same folder) or the full file path. If no argument is given, a dialog window pops up. Syntax is expected to be in the format explained in the dump message documentation.

method.name: writetxt
method.description: A write message will save the current state (as llll) in a file, in a human-readable text format. If an argument is given, this is the filename (if the file is in the search path or in the same folder) or the full file path. If no argument is given, a dialog window pops up. Syntax is expected to be in the format explained in the dump message documentation.

attribute.name: arccolor
attribute.description: Sets the color of the arcs.

attribute.name: autocoordalgo
attribute.description: Sets the node placement algorithm for automatical node coordinates assignment.

attribute.name: autocoordsize
attribute.description: Size of the starting canvas for the autoplacement algorithm.

attribute.name: autocoordwhenupdated
attribute.digest: Automatically Assign Node Coordinates When Updated
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to assign node coordinates automatically, via the node placement algorithm set by the attribute autocoordalgo.

attribute.name: label
attribute.value: Automatically Assign Node Coordinates When Updated

attribute.name: autozoomwhenupdated
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to adjust the zoom automatically when the graph is changed.

attribute.name: axescolor
attribute.description: Sets the color of the x and y axes.

attribute.name: axeslabelscolor
attribute.description: Sets the color of the x and y axes labels.

attribute.name: continuousbang
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to send the changed bang continuously during mousedrag actions.

attribute.name: edgeretouch
attribute.description: Sets the edge retouch mode.

attribute.name: edgewidth
attribute.description: Sets the line with for the edge lines.

attribute.name: linestyle
attribute.description: Sets the line style for the edges.

attribute.name: memory
attribute.description: Sets a number N so that repetitions of the same grain will be avoided before N steps have passed. Set this value to "inf" to always avoid repetitions. Default is 1: repetition is only avoided with the current step (i.e. the new step will be different from the current one. A turtleclear message will reset the memory.

attribute.name: messagebang
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to send the changed bang also when changes happen via messages.

attribute.name: nodebgcolor
attribute.description: Sets the default color of the node background.

attribute.name: nodebordercolor
attribute.description: Sets the default color of the border of nodes.

attribute.name: nodeformat
attribute.description: Sets the format for the node display.

attribute.name: nodeshape
attribute.description: Sets the line style for the edges.

attribute.name: nodesize
attribute.description: Size of the node (0. meaning auto).

attribute.name: nodetextcolor
attribute.description: Sets the default color of the text in the nodes.

attribute.name: notify
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to send notifications for interface activities (such as clicks, mousehovers, etc.). Notifications are sent through the dedicated outlet. If the "Verbose" mode is set, whenever meaningful, the state of the notified element will be also output.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the following:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message. To keep the representation invertible (i.e., to allow a bach object receiving a text-format llll to interpret it exactly as if it was native format, except for the size limitation), some specific kinds of symbols are preceded by a backtick: namely, symbols containing parens, or containing textual representations of numbers or pitches, or beginning with a backtick, plus the symbols "null" and "nil" (distinct from the reserved words "null" and "nil" representing the empty list and the empty sublist) are preceded by a backtick. Moreover, the symbols "int", "float" or "list" are preceded by a backtick only if they are the first element of an llll, to distinguish them from the corresponding reserved messages of Max.
m: 'max' output: mostly equivalent to the "t" specifier, but no symbol is backticket except "int", "float" and "list" at the beginning of an llll. It is important to notice that, differently from text-format lllls proper, Max-format lllls might not be invertible even if they do not reach the size limit for Max message. This means that a bach object receiving a Max-format llll output from another bach object might interpret it differently from the original, or in some cases might even reject it.
x: disabled output (nothing is output)
p: 'portal' output: only used by bach.portal to intercept the @out attribute specified while creating the abstraction (see bach.portal).
The native output is recommended, unless communication with standard Max messages is needed. Disabling unused outputs can be useful if extreme optimization of the patch is needed.

attribute.name: playcolor
attribute.description: Sets the playing color.

attribute.name: playstep
attribute.description: Sets the play step interval in milliseconds.

attribute.name: showarrows
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to show the edge arrows.

attribute.name: showaxes
attribute.description: Toggles the display of the x and y axes.

attribute.name: showaxeslabels
attribute.description: Toggles the display of the x and y axes labels.

attribute.name: showedges
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to show the edges.

attribute.name: shownodes
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to show the nodes.

attribute.name: showweights
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to show the edge weights.

attribute.name: snaptogrid
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to snap items to the grid.

attribute.name: tonedivision
attribute.description: In the bach environment, the tone division defines the microtonal accuracy of the symbolic representation, by representing the number of steps in which each tone is divided. For the standard semitonal representation (where just sharps and flats suffice), one can stick with tonedivision being 2, meaning: the tone is divided into two semitones. By increasing this value, the microtonal grid gets more dense: for instance, 4 is the quartertonal grid (where each tone is divided in 4 quartertones); 8 is the eight-tonal grid, and so on.

attribute.name: turtlecolor
attribute.description: Sets the color of the turtle.

attribute.name: undobang
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to send the changed bang also when changes happen via messages.

attribute.name: undobeforeplay
attribute.digest: Save State For Undo Before Playing
attribute.description: Toggles the ability to save the state for an undo step before playing

attribute.name: label
attribute.value: Save State For Undo Before Playing

attribute.name: vzoom
attribute.description: Sets the object vertical zoom percentage

attribute.name: xlabel
attribute.description: Sets the label for the x axis.

attribute.name: ylabel
attribute.description: Sets the label for the y axis.

attribute.name: zoom
attribute.description: Sets the object zoom percentage (or horizontal zoom, if the object is separately zoommable on horizontal and on vertical axis).

c74object.discussion: The module relies on the Boost library in order to provide node autopositioning.

entry.name: Outlet 2 (llll)
entry.description: Node value on mouse hover or click.

entry.name: Outlet 4 (bang)
entry.description: bang when object is changed via the interface.

entry.name: More details
entry.description: The module relies on the Boost library in order to provide node autopositioning.
